intro: Acetosella sulfurea, commonly known as sulfur sorrel, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green leaves and clusters of pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Its leaves contain oxalic acid, which can be toxic if ingested in large quantities. Acetosella sulfurea is also known for its ability to tolerate shade and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
